flow.descriptionCdata:
bbb544ac-2c7a-4d6c-a157-834cca7c7efe.0bbc96ea-e654-4605-9bf7-ad753ef6421c.prompt=enter host bbb544ac-2c7a-4d6c-a157-834cca7c7efe.2c3434e1-b181-4189-a57f-b85288880388.prompt=Enter a value for targetHost bbb544ac-2c7a-4d6c-a157-834cca7c7efe.2d138627-9abb-4c6b-b440-977a29aa7b2b.prompt=Enter a value for message bbb544ac-2c7a-4d6c-a157-834cca7c7efe.3834e051-d9c4-4e09-a6cb-707488c0aa55.description=
Runs a WMI query and formats the results.

Inputs\:
wql query - the query to run.
namespace - the wmi namespace to run the query in.
host - the host to run the query against.
user - a user to authenticate with host as.
password - the password for user.
format - How to format the query's results (text or csv).

Responses\:
success - the operation succeeded.
failure - an error occurred.

Responses\:

bbb544ac-2c7a-4d6c-a157-834cca7c7efe.66ab02be-c2b1-4bc0-b2b8-54169f8d9a3b.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];

bbb544ac-2c7a-4d6c-a157-834cca7c7efe.c74ccf24-be82-4e90-a039-0fec77b194a0.description=
Runs the Ping command locally. 

Input Parameters\:
targetHost - target host to ping
packetSize - size of the ping packet
packetCount - number of packets to send

Responses\:
success - the command was executed successfully
failure - the command could not be executed

Returns\:
packetsSent - the number of packets sent
packetsReceived - the number of packets received
percentagePacketsLost - the percentage of packets lost
transmissionTimeMin - minimum time taken for transmitting the packet
transmissionTimeMax - maximum time taken for transmitting the packet
transmissionTimeAvg - average time taken for transmitting the packet
returnResult - the raw output of the command
returnCode - return code from the executed command
error - the STDERR of the command
bbb544ac-2c7a-4d6c-a157-834cca7c7efe.cc48b23e-e91d-4885-b077-2e0a9e1b7c67.description=
Runs a WMI query and formats the results.

Inputs\:
wql query - the query to run.
namespace - the wmi namespace to run the query in.
host - the host to run the query against.
user - a user to authenticate with host as.
password - the password for user.
format - How to format the query's results (text or csv).

Responses\:
success - the operation succeeded.
failure - an error occurred.
bbb544ac-2c7a-4d6c-a157-834cca7c7efe.description=
This flow checks the overall health of a Windows server. It checks for many common problems, such as testing if the server is running, how much free memory the server has, and what percentage of its CPU is currently being utilized. A summary of the server's health is then either sent as email, displayed on the screen, written to a file or ignored.

NOTE\:
Only Windows XP, Windows 2003 and later versions track system uptime. Previous systems will always fail to obtain system uptime.

Inputs\:
host - The server to check the health of.
user - The username to use when authenticating with the host. Not required for localhost.
password - The password to use when authenticating with the host. Not required for localhost.
notifyMethod - How to notify the user the out come of the health check.
vitalProcesses - A list of comma separated values giving the name of the processes that are vital for Windows and should be running. Currently, this value is set to\: 				                      svchost.exe,lsass.exe,smss.exe,System,explorer.exe,services.exe,winlogon.exe
	     New processes can be added or existing ones can be removed from the list.	
packetCount - The number of ping packets to send.
packetSize - The size of the ping packet.

Responses\:
success - Health check prepared.
failure - Something went wrong.
bbb544ac-2c7a-4d6c-a157-834cca7c7efe.e4d92446-749c-4c7e-bbc9-9d1971f8851a.prompt=Please enter a user name\: bbb544ac-2c7a-4d6c-a157-834cca7c7efe.ec027174-fdbc-4ef9-a51f-3303dd599dcb.prompt=Please enter a password\: bbb544ac-2c7a-4d6c-a157-834cca7c7efe.fd43367d-e821-49c4-ade5-871aa33e5832.description=
Queries how long it has been since the target computer was rebooted.
bbb544ac-2c7a-4d6c-a157-834cca7c7efe.fe9d02d3-8527-42dd-a5bb-1721659ae35b.description=

Displays a message to the user.

Inputs\:
  message - The message text to display
  title - The title on the message window. Defaults to "Status message".

Responses\:
  Always returns success.

Examples\:
  In order to display the message "Finished" to the user, go to the 
  detail screen for the input named "message" and change the Otherwise option
  from Prompt User to Use Constant.  Then enter the text "Finished" into the
  Constant Value field.

  References to flow variables in the Contant Value field are expanded so that
  the text may be dynamic.  Flow variable references are of the form
  ${variable}.  For example, the text\:
     ${count} systems were modified 
  could be used to display a message about the number of systems that were
  repaired, whose value is in the flow variable "count".

  When the message is displayed, it will properly render any embedded html
  tags, which permits creating messages with more advanced formatting.  For 
  example to display a message in italics you could use\:
    This is important
  or to display a message in red\:
    This is really  important

  You can create messages that contain multiple lines by entering a multiple
  line message in the Constant Value field, or by using HTML 
 tags for line
  breaks.  Note that \n characters are displayed literally and are not used for
  creating multiple lines.
flow.name: E5T2 Windows Health Check

scriptlet.name: Step Resolved : success in Flow E5T2 Windows Health Check (4c4f5a55-68c3-4660-9219-10c39a7563ef)
Step Get Running Process List in Flow E5T2 Windows Health Check (3834e051-d9c4-4e09-a6cb-707488c0aa55)
Step Check for Malfunctioning Devices in Flow E5T2 Windows Health Check (cc48b23e-e91d-4885-b077-2e0a9e1b7c67)

staticBinding.value: Select * from Win32_PnPEntity where Status = 'Error' OR Status = 'Pred Fail' OR Status = 'Stressed ' OR Status = 'NonRecover'

scriptlet.name: Step Get Network Interface Errors in Flow E5T2 Windows Health Check (4d521944-0385-4f98-8107-cddd520a6667)

staticBinding.value: Select Name, ConfigManagerErrorCode from Win32_NetworkAdapter where ConfigManagerErrorCode > 0

scriptlet.name: Step Get Host Name in Flow E5T2 Windows Health Check (972da3cd-15bb-4fa2-afba-cc1624ed0eab)
Step Get FileSystem Information in Flow E5T2 Windows Health Check (96feeeb5-05af-4f91-80a7-14a20c0d74df)

staticBinding.value: Select Name, FreeSpace, Size from Win32_LogicalDisk

Step Get System Uptime in Flow E5T2 Windows Health Check (fd43367d-e821-49c4-ade5-871aa33e5832)
Step Get Processor Count/Status in Flow E5T2 Windows Health Check (8a9e0240-6c88-42a9-b79c-ae3543112c76)
Step Ping Target System in Flow E5T2 Windows Health Check (c74ccf24-be82-4e90-a039-0fec77b194a0)
